III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
1

(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth tested positive for marijuana upon arriving at a new facility
and being discharged by this facility.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on June 5, 2025,
and reported Youth A used marijuana daily prior to coming
into care. Complainant reported Youth A denied getting
marijuana from any staff or youth during her 56-day placement at
the facility. Complainant stated the marijuana test Youth A took
only shows positive or negative for marijuana, not the level of
marijuana in the system. Complainant described the marijuana
could still have been in Youth A’s system from her daily use prior
to entering the facility. Complainant denied having any concerns
with the facility while Youth A was placed there.
Youth A was interviewed via Teams on June 5, 2025. Youth A
described being brought to her new placement by Worker and
upon arrival tested positive for marijuana. Youth A stated the last
time she used marijuana was while she was home, prior to being
placed at Osceola Youth Center. Youth A reported she used to
smoke two ounces of marijuana a day for about four straight
months. Youth A denied any staff member or youth providing
marijuana to her while at Osceola Youth Center. Youth A denied
ever getting or using marijuana while on any outing at Osceola
Youth Center. Youth A denied using marijuana while she was at
Osceola Youth Center. Youth A reported she never saw any
youth or staff member use, smoke, vape marijuana while at
Osceola Youth Center.
Director and Supervisor were interviewed face to face,
separately, at the facility on June 5, 2025. They both stated
they were not aware of any concerns or issues with staff or youth
providing or using marijuana at the facility. Supervisor reported he
has not heard anything being talked about on any of the units by
any of the youth.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed face to face,
separately, at the facility on June 5, 2025. They both denied
seeing any youth or staff use/smoke marijuana. They both
reported they have not ever been offered marijuana by any staff or
youth at the facility. They both denied having any knowledge of
2

any youth at the facility being offered marijuana by any staff
member.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on June 24, 2025.
Youth D denied seeing any youth or staff use/smoke marijuana.
Youth D reported she was never offered marijuana by any youth
or staff member while she was placed at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on June 26, 2025. Staff
1 denied ever seeing any youth or staff member smoke or use
marijuana at the facility. Staff 1 reported he has never seen or
heard of any staff or youth providing marijuana to any youth at the
facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Standards of Conduct Policy. Policy documents, “Staff are
always expected to maintain ethical and professional
behavior. This includes the expectation that staff are to
interact with youth in a manner promoting their emotional
and physical safety while incorporating trauma responsive
practices. While not intended to list all the forms of behavior
that are considered unacceptable in the workplace, the
following are examples of rule infractions or misconduct
that may result in disciplinary action, including termination
of employment: Possession, distribution, sale, transfer, or
use of alcohol or illegal drugs in the workplace (See
Section 6.6, Substance Abuse).”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, no information was provided to support Youth A
received marijuana from any staff member or youth while at the
facility. There was no information provided Youth A was using
marijuana while at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
3

sir_summary.summary: A youth tested positive for marijuana upon arriving at a new placement after being discharged from Osceola Youth Center. An investigation, including interviews with the youth, other residents, staff, and leadership, found no evidence that the youth obtained or used marijuana while at the facility, concluding the positive test likely stemmed from her admitted daily use prior to placement. No substantiated culpability lies with the facility, as the investigation did not support the allegation that staff or youth provided marijuana or that use occurred on-site.
